‚è∫ I'll start by scanning the codebase to understand this repository, particularly focusing on the markdown documentation
to get context about what schmux is and how it works.
‚è∫ Explore(Explore schmux codebase)
‚è∫ I now have a comprehensive understanding of the schmux codebase. Here's a summary:
Schmux Overview
Schmux is a multi-agent AI orchestration system that runs multiple AI coding agents (Claude Code, Codex, etc.)
simultaneously across isolated tmux sessions, with a web dashboard for real-time monitoring and management.
Key Architecture Points
1. Daemon-based - Go daemon (internal/daemon/daemon.go) runs in background managing:
- Dashboard server on :7337
- Session spawning/disposal via tmux
- Workspace management (git clones/checkouts)
- Log streaming via WebSocket
2. Workspace Isolation - Each agent gets its own cloned workspace directory, enabling parallel work on the same
codebase
3. Session Management - tmux sessions with fixed window sizes (120x40), pipe-pane logging, PID tracking
4. Real-time Dashboard - React SPA with:
- Live terminal output via WebSocket
- Git diff viewing across agents
- Session controls (spawn, dispose, attach)
Current State
- Version: v0.5 - "Mostly working, occasionally on fire"
- Recent changes: Git status polling improvements, spawn error handling, first-run wizard fixes
- Modified files: SessionDetailPage.jsx, dashboard handlers/server.go
- New component: NudgeNikModal.jsx (untracked)
Technology Stack
- Backend: Go 1.21+, tmux, git, gorilla/websocket
- Frontend: React 18, Vite, xterm.js, react-diff-viewer
I'm ready to assess what other coding agents working in this workspace might need. What interactions or context would
you like me to review?
‚úª Crunched for 1m 36s
‚è∫ Yes. Rebuild and test:
go run ./cmd/build-dashboard
go test ./internal/tmux/...
